document.heading: Owner-Occupant Residential Tax Credit and Exemption Act of 2004

history.narrative: Law 15-135, the “Owner-Occupant Residential Tax Credit and Exemption Act of 2004”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-303, which was referred to Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 2, 2003, and January 21, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 6, 2004, it was assigned Act No. 15-350 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-135 became effective on April 22, 2004.
